task.title: Editing a data set in MVS Explorer
task.shortdesc: Use the MVS Explorer to edit a data set member and save the changes.

context.p: The MVS Explorer view allows you to browse the MVS file system by creating filters against data set names.

step.cmd: Click the Start menu on Zowe Desktop.
Scroll down to find the MVS Explorer icon. Right-click and select Pin to taskbar to pin this application to the desktop for later use.
Click the MVS Explorer icon on the task bar.
step.info: The MVS Explorer opens. The Filter field is pre-filled with the filter string TRTRADM. All the data sets matching this filter are displayed. You can expand a data set name and see the members in it.

step.cmd: Locate and click the data set member APPLY1 in TSTRADM.SMPE.JCL.

image.alt: The location of the data set member

step.cmd: Edit the data set by adding NOTIFY=TSTRADM.
Click SAVE to save your edits.

taskbody.postreq: Next, youâ€™ll use Zowe CLI to view and add another change to the same data set.
